_header: This world is full of stableness
Bibliographic Ghosts: Oxford, Bodleian Library Bodley 779 (SC 2567), f. 189: see 6698.
_description: John Lydgate, ‘Riȝt as the crabbe goth forward’ — seven eight-line stanzas with this refrain (Envoy included)

Bod686.First Lines:
This worlde is ful of stablenesseTher is þer inne no
                    variaunce…
Bod686.Last Lines:
…þe heuenly signe maketh demonstraunceRight as þe
                    Crab goth forewarde
Bod686.Attributed Title:
Here begynneþ þe Tretis of þe Crabbe (f. 190), Hererendeth
                    þe tresi of þe Crabbe And begynneþ a tretis of þe
                    rammeshorne (at the end)

CamTCC600.First Lines:
Þis worlde is ful of stabulnesseþer is þer Inne no
                    varyaunceBut trouthe feyth and gentylesseSecrenesse and
                    assuraqunce…
CamTCC600.Last Lines:
…Howe þat þe Crabbe gooþe bakwardÞe
                    hevenly signe makeþe demonstraunce
CamTCC600.Attributed Author:
Takeþe heede my lordes for here foloweþe a balade of þe
                    same sentence made in oure englisshe langage by daun Iohan Lidegate of Bury
                    þe Munke noue Iugeþe yee þat beoþe kunyng which yowe
                    lykeþe þe beter þe ffrensh or þenglissh (p. 50)
CamTCC600.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. II: Secular Poems.
EETS
         o.s. 192 (1934); repr. 1961: 465-7 (with a French version).

BLHar2251.First Lines:
This world is ful of stabilnesseThere is therin no
                    variaunce…
BLHar2251.Last Lines:
…The heuenly signe makith demonstraunceHow worldly thynges goo
                    forward
BLHar2251.Editions:
Halliwell-Phillipps,  James Orchard,
                        ed.  
             A Selection from the Minor Poems of Don John Lydgate.
Percy Society
         2. London: T. Richard, 1840: 58-60.

BLHar4011.First Lines:
…Plente is foundyn No in gardScharsite is gone vn to
                    myshaunce…
BLHar4011.Last Lines:
…To gyue ensampull in substaunceRiȝ;t as the crabbe goth
                    forward

BLAdd29729.First Lines:
This world is full of stabellnesther is ther in no
                    varyaunce…
BLAdd29729.Last Lines:
…þe heuenly signe maketh demonstrauncehow þat
                    þe Crabbe goth bakward
BLAdd29729.Attributed Author: dane Iohn lidgate of bury þe munke (f. 154)
BLAdd29729.Attributed Title:
Here foloweth a balade of made in our engelishe langage by dane Iohn
                    lidgate of bury þe munke translated out of frenche in to engelishe (f.
                    154)

HunEL26A13.First Lines:
This worlde is ful of stablenesseTher is ther ynne no
                    veriaunce…
HunEL26A13.Last Lines:
…The heueneli signe maketh demonstraunceRight as the Crabbe
                    gothe forewarde
HunEL26A13.Attributed Title: A sotel resoun of the Crabbe (f. 14)
